org.easylibs.options

Annotation Type Arg


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value={FIELD,METHOD,TYPE})
public @interface Arg
    The Arg annotation marks a class field or method as a BeanOptionImpl. It's attributes are used to configure the BeanOptionImpl.

    Field requirments

    If a class field is annotated with Arg annotation, the field must not be marked final and must otherwise be writable using java reflection API. The field type must also be mappable from a string argument to a value and an appropriate TypeMapper must be registered with the TypeRegistry.

    Any field for an option, which takes no-argument, such as -a, must be of type boolean. When the option is present on the command line, the field's boolean value will be set to true. Other the field's value won't be changed.

    The field's value is changed when the option is encountered on the command line and argument is present or for a no-argument option, the boolean field is set to true.

    If the attribute optional() is set to true, the field's value is unchanged if the option's argument on the command line is not present.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.String name
      A new option name which should follow the Posix standard of lowercase '-' separated set of words.
      boolean ommit
      The class member is ommitted as consideration for being an option.
      boolean optional
      If a BeanOptionImpl takes an argument, this attribute makes the argument optional.

    • Element Detail

      • name

        public abstract java.lang.String name
        A new option name which should follow the Posix standard of lowercase '-' separated set of words.
        Returns:
        the option name
        Default:
        ""

      • optional

        public abstract boolean optional
        If a BeanOptionImpl takes an argument, this attribute makes the argument optional.

        If argument is optional and is not present on the command line, the reflected bean field or method setter will not be changed or invoked. However the presence of the option itself on the command line can be checked with the boolean method Option.isMatched(), which will return true.

        If argument is required false which is the default, an error will be raised if the argument is missing from the command line. The bean's underlying class field or method will be set or invoked with the argument mapped value.

        Returns:
        true, if argument value is optional, otherwise it is required. Default is false.
        Default:
        false

      • ommit

        public abstract boolean ommit
        The class member is ommitted as consideration for being an option. This is useful when an annotated class implicitely defines options for every class member but you want to skip a particular one.
        Returns:
        true, if to be ignored and ommitted as an option
        Default:
        false
